task.title: Connecting the Cassette Recorder Cable
task.shortdesc: Describes the process for connecting the data cassette recorder cable to the TRS-80 Expansion Interface.

context.p: The interconnect cable for an expansion module is provided with that unit. See Figure 4 for Hood Assembly and Installation.
context.note: A Dummy Plug is provided with your Cassette Recorder. Plug it in to the MIC jack. This Plug disconnects the built-in microphone so it won't pick up sounds while you are loading tapes.
Your Cassette Recorders may be powered by batteries or from a 120 VAC source. Thus, AC power cords are optional.

step.cmd: Connect the Cassette Recorder Cable (DIN plug on one end and three plugs on the other) to the Tape I/O connector that is located on the rear of the Expansion Interface nearest the Power Cord exits.
Of the three plugs on the other end of the Cable:

substep.cmd: Connect the black plug to the EAR jack on the side of the Cassette Recorder.
Connect the larger gray plug to the AUX jack.
Connect the smaller gray plug to the REM jack.

step.cmd: Connect the Cassette Recorder Jumper Cable to the center DIN connector on the rear of the Expansion Interface. Connect the other end to the TAPE connector on the right rear of the TRS-80.
Connect the Video Cable from the Video Display to the VIDEO connector on the right rear of the TRS-80

postreq.p: The TRS-80 Expansion Interface has been designed to support the Video Display module. Set the feet of the Video Display in the recesses in the Power Supply and PCB Housing Doors.
